1.text: My son, if thou art become surety for thy neighbour, If thou hast struck thy hands for a stranger—

2.text: Thou art snared by the words of thy mouth, Thou art caught by the words of thy mouth—

3.text: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, Seeing thou art come into the hand of thy neighbour; Go, humble thyself, and urge thy neighbour.

4.text: Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.

5.text: Deliver thyself as a gazelle from the hand [of the hunter], And as a bird from the hand of the fowler.

6.text: Go to the ant, thou sluggard; Consider her ways, and be wise;

7.text: Which having no chief, Overseer, or ruler,

8.text: Provideth her bread in the summer, And gatherest her food in the harvest.

9.text: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? When wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?

10.text: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, A little folding of the hands to sleep’—

11.text: So shall thy poverty come as a runner, And thy want as an armed man.

12.text: A base person, a man of iniquity, Is he that walketh with a froward mouth;

13.text: That winketh with his eyes, that scrapeth with his feet, That pointeth with his fingers;

14.text: Frowardness is in his heart, he deviseth evil continually; He soweth discord.

15.text: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; On a sudden shall he be broken, and that without remedy.

16.text: There are six things which the LORD hateth, Yea, seven which are an abomination unto Him:

17.text: Haughty eyes, a lying tongue, And hands that shed innocent blood;

18.text: A heart that deviseth wicked thoughts, Feet that are swift in running to evil;

19.text: A false witness that breatheth out lies, And he that soweth discord among brethren.

20.text: My son, keep the commandment of thy father, And forsake not the teaching of thy mother;

21.text: Bind them continually upon thy heart, Tie them about thy neck.

22.text: When thou walkest, it shall lead thee, When thou liest down, it shall watch over thee; And when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.

23.text: For the commandment is a lamp, and the teaching is light, And reproofs of instruction are the way of life;

24.text: To keep thee from the evil woman, From the smoothness of the alien tongue.

25.text: Lust not after her beauty in thy heart; Neither let her captivate thee with her eyelids.

26.text: For on account of a harlot a man is brought to a loaf of bread, But the adulteress hunteth for the precious life.

27.text: Can a man take fire in his bosom, And his clothes not be burned?

28.text: Or can one walk upon hot coals, And his feet not be scorched?

29.text: So he that goeth in to his neighbour’s wife; Whosoever toucheth her shall not go unpunished.

30.text: Men do not despise a thief, if he steal To satisfy his soul when he is hungry;

31.text: But if he be found, he must restore sevenfold, He must give all the substance of his house.

32.text: He that committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding; He doeth it that would destroy his own soul.

33.text: Wounds and dishonour shall he get, And his reproach shall not be wiped away.

34.text: For jealousy is the rage of a man, And he will not spare in the day of vengeance.

35.text: He will not regard any ransom; Neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.
